channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: New York sues Valve, alleging its loot boxes are ‘quintessential gambling’
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is suing Valve for "illegally promoting gambling" through the loot box systems it has built for video games like Counter-Strike 2, Team Fortress 2, and Dota 2, according to a press release. The attorney general seeks to "permanently stop Valve from promoting gambling features in its games, disgorge all […]

item.title: AI and deepfakes are proving to be a security nightmare for businesses everywhere
item.description: Cybercriminals are using AI to speed up and improve their tactics, new report warns.

item.title: Revolut Ex-Employee Allegedly Tried to Extort a Customer for Crypto Ransom
item.description: It highlights the perils of "trusted third parties"—and reminds us what the whole point of decentralized protocols was to begin with.

item.title: Discord Is Delaying Age Checks Following User Backlash
item.description: The is pushing back the global rollout of age checks until later this year.

item.title: Nvidia has another record quarter amid record capex spends
item.description: "The demand for tokens in the world has gone completely exponential," Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said about the company's earnings.

item.title: Chicken Jockey Beaten By Furries as ‘Zootopia 2’ Becomes 2025’s Top Domestic Movie
item.description: 'A Minecraft Movie' still raked in an alarming amount of money—it just made slightly less than Disney's animated smash.

item.description: The GL.iNet Slate 7 is a Wi-Fi 7-capable router designed for home and small-business use that punches above its weight.

item.title: How the new Galaxy S26 phones stack up against each other on paper
item.description: Samsung has just announced its new Galaxy S26 lineup, which includes the S26, S26 Plus, and S26 Ultra. While they aren't radical departures from last year's models, they bring a handful of notable upgrades. All three run on Qualcomm's Galaxy-centric Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5, which delivers improved performance and powers a slew of new […]

item.title: VPN deal of the week: NordVPN’s birthday sale offers a free way to upgrade your phone’s privacy to Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra levels
item.description: Avoid forking out on an entirely new phone while boosting your phone's privacy

item.title: Samsung's new super-powered meeting room displays want to make your video calls far more interactive, whether you like it or not
item.description: Samsung’s WAFX-P interactive display combines AI tools, dual-pen input, live captions, and multi-device integration for collaborative business environments.

item.title: Snap is hosting its own creator awards show
item.description: It seems like any and every industry can have its own awards show these days. And why not? Most of us appreciate a chance to bust out the sequins and satin from time to time. If you can celebrate excellent work or make some extra biz dev bucks at the same time, all the better. Snap is the latest social media company to launch its own take on the glitz and glam. The Snappy Awards Show will be held at the company's headquarters on March 31. Comedian and content creator Matt Friend will host the event.Snapchat has been adding more tools for influencers to build audiences, most recently launching ...

item.title: The AI Arms Race Joins Forces With the Literal Arms Race, Fueling $348 Trillion in Debt
item.description: It's the biggest annual increase since the pandemic.

item.title: Skate's developer is laying off staff before the game leaves early access
item.description: Full Circle, the developer behind the new Skate game, has announced that it is restructuring and laying off staff. It's not yet clear how many roles will be impacted by the changes, but the restructuring is happening less than six months after skate. launched in early access on September 15, 2025."We’re reshaping Full Circle to better support skate.’s long-term future," Full Circle says. "These shifts mean making changes to our team structure, and some roles will be impacted. The teammates affected are talented colleagues and friends who helped build the foundation of skate. Their creativity a...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 vs. iPhone 17: Is It All About AI?
item.description: On paper, the Apple and Samsung's latest phones are nearly neck and neck on all major features.

item.title: Limited-time offer: Windows 11 Pro lifetime license for just $12.97
item.description: Upgrade to Microsoft Windows 11 Pro for $12.97 and get a lifetime license with advanced security and smarter productivity features.

item.title: Corsair is halting Drop sales after March 25th
item.description: The Drop store, which was acquired by gaming gear giant Corsair in 2023, was a haven for mechanical keyboard enthusiasts and audiophiles to discover and buy hard-to-find gear - sometimes at surprisingly good prices. The company will cease sales after March 25th at 11:59PM PT, which is also the cut off to redeem Drop Rewards. […]

item.title: Everything announced at Samsung Unpacked: The Galaxy S26 Ultra, Galaxy Buds 4 and more
item.description: Mobile World Congress is right around the corner, but Samsung got out ahead of many rivals that will be showing off new handsets at that event by running the latest edition of Unpacked on Wednesday. At its event in San Francisco’s Palace of Fine Arts, the company revealed the Galaxy S26 lineup, which includes the base S26, the S26+ and the S26 Ultra. We've got some hands-on time with all three handsets as well, and you can read about our in-person experience with the Galaxy S26 Ultra, as well as our S26 and S26+ impressions in those articles.In addition to those, Samsung announced the Galaxy B...
